title: TURBO MODE: The Data Behind Your Spell Spamming

replies.body: I dont understand why Riot doesnt make a mobile 15-key controller and mouse for phones so that League can be played anywhere everywhere at all times.

I have good news for you, friend. Riot's top developers have recently devised a totally new type of mobile computer. We're calling it the League Adapted Portable Toolkit Omnidirectional Plaything, or L.A.P.T.O.P for short. Go to any electronics store near you to buy one!

My god this is why Cactopus is my favorite rioter.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
God Save The Cactopus
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
you sir are a wizard {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
okay why does zombie brand look like Bill Cosby...{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
Jackie Chan?
Rekt
The L.A.P.T.O.P. is available now for purchase? Now i can play at work >:)
You miss 100% of the spells you don't cast. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
I miss 100% of the spells that I do cast, tbh
can confirm
how do i land these pantheon spears
Sometimes targeted spells are harder to land than skillshots
**Thanks,** {{champion:157}}**!**
I liked this information
This man should be a professional critic.
so, any word on the vape nation graves skin?
You've proven my point again. You have excellent taste in memes, sir.
@slav I write stuff! I edited this post :D

The lower number of spell casted in lower ELOs with {{champion:92}} isn't accurate

Low ELO {{champion:92}} 's are usually dead.

If they're usually dead, I would imagine that they would be casting fewer spells??


But I'm not an expert or anything.

hey there. 
so you're the data analyst in charge of all these pretty graphs eh?
Exactly the person I wanted to speak to. 

Listen. About the quality of your work so far. 
Much to be improved.
Thanks for the input - what feedback or advice would you give me/us about improvements?

I actually really liked this entire post but I would say that I would like to see how many spell casts per a minute. The y-axis was not labeled with any numbers and I was a little sad. I wanted to see how different the uses were, not just the general curve. I mean as far as i know, the median bronze riven could use q 5 times less a minute or .05 times less than a diamond riven so it's hard to see how significant the differences are.

Good point-- I guess we didn't notice because @jeopardy's {{champion:92}} never dies.

Jokes aside, it's not a bad idea to take a look at this analysis with 
> casts/(game_length - time_spent_dead)

instead of just

> casts/game_length

to control for uptime.

Thanks for the suggestion!
Can we get data proof of damage taken being inverse to laugh emotes for singed?

That's not too hard to calculate.

Singed's that spam laugh > Singed's that tilt enemies > Singed's that get chased > Singed's that win.

Just check his win rate.

I happen to be a level 5 singed player. I've learned from experience that spamming laugh and Mastery at the same time while you run and proxy in the enemy base gives you +1337% Movespeed, +666% tilt, +99.99% win chance.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
The real questions.

Is there any tracking of which key is pressed the most for players across the world? I personally know that my most pressed key is "Y", as I use that key to lock and unlock my screen (I'm weird, I know it, don't judge me). Would just be interesting to see if any other strange trends are also present across the globe!

We generally don't track things that aren't consistently relevant to answering gameplay questions (like how many times you lock/unlock your camera), but we definitely have the ability to do so when the need arises!

That said, I'm glad I found someone else who spams a key to lock/unlock their screen. I used to bind that to 'T' and double tap T instead of hitting space. I guess what I'm trying to say is I like you.
But... T is for trinkets...{{item:3340}}
Nah, it's 4 for trinket. As in "4 the love of god use your damn trinket"
I bound T to laugh so I can laugh-animation-cancel my Riven Q's by basically typing QTQTQT
The QTpie technique
Ooooooo somebody likes somebody. I ship it.
And they're a Rioter. I'm in boiz 8^)
hnnng
I totally cast too often. It made the Athene's change last season really painful for me; I no longer get the free insane mana regen that was "enabling" me to have that playstyle.

One thing Riot Blaustoise loves to do as a midlaner is demand blue buff from his jungler all the time. 


So the solution here is to try to get matchmade to lane against Riot Blaustoise whenever you get the opportunity because he loves giving it to his lane opponents.
Shots.

Summoner spells, please.
Keystone procs, please.
Passive procs please.
Reset procs, please.
And ctrl 1-4 would be pretty interesting.
and a partridge in a pear tree?
I don't know about the different number of Q casts between different MMRs, but I certainly know that my fingers start to hurt after playing too many Evelynn games in a row.

Hey dude, that happens with me sometimes to - I guess it's inevitable when my animation cancels are just so buttery smooth that my Riven spells are always coming off of CD at the perfect times.

Have you or have you not considered using your face?
I hear a shoe also works https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mFOdSxc6cQk {{champion:107}}
{{champion:75}} No Chart could possibly measure how many Q's are used
OP delivers http://imgur.com/cjZ6xnz
